title: Learning Path: cook failed
ai_summary: The user is experiencing a "cook failed" error in Unreal Engine, which indicates an issue during the process of preparing the game's assets for deployment.
ai_what_you_learn: Always check the Output Log for specific error messages during the cook process to pinpoint the cause.
Verify asset integrity by fixing redirectors (Right-click Content folder > Fix Up Redirectors in Folder).
Ensure all necessary plugins are enabled and compatible with your Unreal Engine version.
Reduce texture sizes or compress audio files to optimize asset sizes, especially for mobile builds.

steps.title: Step 1: Understand the Cooking Process
steps.description:
Understanding what the cooking process is and why it's necessary is crucial to troubleshooting failures. It's the process of converting assets into a format suitable for the target platform.

👉 **Action:** Watch the video and pay attention to the explanation of how assets are processed, packaged, and optimized for different platforms. Look for sections explaining the purpose of the cooking process and what happens to assets during this phase.
steps.action: Watch the video and pay attention to the explanation of how assets are processed, packaged, and optimized for different platforms. Look for sections explaining the purpose of the cooking process and what happens to assets during this phase.

content.title: Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine
content.description:
**Why this helps:** This video provides a general overview of packaging a project, which includes the cooking process. Understanding this process helps in debugging cook failures.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Start at the beginning where they explain the overall process of packaging. (5 minutes)

steps.title: Step 2: Diagnose Your Issue
steps.description:
A cook failure usually has specific error messages in the Output Log. Identifying these messages is the first step in diagnosing the problem. While the videos don't show specific error messages, they can guide you on where to look.

👉 **Action:** After the cook fails, open the Output Log in Unreal Engine (Window > Developer Tools > Output Log). Search for lines starting with 'Error:' or 'Warning:'. Look for any file paths or asset names mentioned in the error messages. If the error relates to mobile, check device compatibility.
steps.action: After the cook fails, open the Output Log in Unreal Engine (Window > Developer Tools > Output Log). Search for lines starting with 'Error:' or 'Warning:'. Look for any file paths or asset names mentioned in the error messages. If the error relates to mobile, check device compatibility.

content.title: Building AAA Mobile Games with Unreal Engine | Unreal Fest 2024
content.description:
**Why this helps:** While focused on mobile games, this video might touch upon common issues encountered when packaging for Android, which could provide clues for debugging.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Look for the section where they discuss packaging and optimization for mobile devices. (5 minutes)

steps.title: Step 3: Apply the Fix
steps.description:
Based on the error messages from the Output Log, take corrective actions. Common fixes include fixing redirectors, ensuring plugin compatibility, and resolving asset issues.

👉 **Action:** If the error messages point to specific assets, try re-importing them or verifying their settings. For plugin-related errors, ensure the plugin is enabled and compatible with your Unreal Engine version. Also, try cleaning the DerivedDataCache (DDC).
steps.action: If the error messages point to specific assets, try re-importing them or verifying their settings. For plugin-related errors, ensure the plugin is enabled and compatible with your Unreal Engine version. Also, try cleaning the DerivedDataCache (DDC).

content.title: Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine
content.description:
**Why this helps:** While not directly addressing specific fixes, this video may demonstrate the general workflow for preparing a project for packaging, and potential gotchas that can lead to failures.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Look for sections related to asset preparation and project settings before packaging. (5 minutes)

steps.title: Step 4: Prevent Future Issues
steps.description:
To minimize future cook failures, maintain good project hygiene. This includes regularly fixing redirectors, validating assets, and keeping plugins up-to-date.

👉 **Action:** Periodically check for and fix redirectors (Right-click Content folder > Fix Up Redirectors in Folder). Regularly validate assets (Right-click asset > Validate). Keep your Unreal Engine version and plugins updated. Use source control to track changes and revert problematic commits.
steps.action: Periodically check for and fix redirectors (Right-click Content folder > Fix Up Redirectors in Folder). Regularly validate assets (Right-click asset > Validate). Keep your Unreal Engine version and plugins updated. Use source control to track changes and revert problematic commits.

content.title: Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine
content.description:
**Why this helps:** This video can indirectly help by demonstrating best practices for project organization and asset management that can prevent issues leading to cook failures.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Review the entire video for general project management tips. (10 minutes)
